For example, with reference to the example interface screen in Fig. 27, if up swipes at the three partitions 2280a, 2280b, 2280c are used to input the corresponding displayed sets 2760a, 2260b, 2260c, in addition to an up swipe in the left partition 2280a, a different gesture such as a right swipe anywhere on the virtual keyboard 2120 can be used to input the highest ranked displayed set. In some examples, tapping the <space> bar can cause the highest ranked displayed set to be inputted.

Referring to Fig. 28, in some examples, the defined arrangement includes displaying the highest ranked set inline with the inputted characters. In the example in Fig. 28, the defined arrangement includes the highest ranked set 2890 displayed inline with the inputted characters, and the three next highest ranked sets 2260a, 2260b, 2260c displayed horizontally.

In these examples, a first gesture such as an up swipe at one of the partitions 2280a, 2280b, 2280c of the virtual keyboard 2120 inputs the corresponding displayed set 2260a, 2260b, 2260c; and a second gesture such as a right swipe anywhere on the virtual keyboard 2110 inputs the highest ranked displayed set 2890. In some examples, tapping the <space> bar inputs the highest ranked displayed set.

In the example shown in Fig. 28, the highest ranked displayed set 2890 is in the defined arrangement inline with the inputted characters, and the predicted characters needed to complete the set (i.e. "ample") are highlighted. Non-limiting examples of highlighting include bolding, ghosting, inverting, italizicing or otherwise distinguishing the predicted characters from the inputted characters. In some examples, the predicted characters are distinguished by a small gap between the inputted characters and the predicted characters. In some examples, the predicted characters are distinguished simply by their relative location to the cursor or carat.

Referring to Fig. 22, in some examples, the different partitions are highlighted such that a user can be made aware of each partition. For example, in Fig. 22, the region in the left partition 2280a may be displayed with a blue background, the region in the centre partition 2280b may be displayed with a red background, and the region in the right partition 2280c may be displayed with a yellow background. In some examples, the letters on the keys of the virtual keyboard 2120 can be displayed in different colours based on the partition in which they fall. In some examples, the divider bar 2299 can display different colours distinguishing the different partitions. Any other suitable highlighting which can indicate to a user the different partitions can be used.

In some examples, the displayed sets 2260a, 2260b, 2260c can be displayed in the colours corresponding to the highlighting of their respective partition. For example, if the left partition 2280a is highlighted in red, the left displayed set 2260a can be displayed in red; if the centre partition 2280b is highlighted in blue, the centre displayed set 2260b can be displayed in blue; and if the right partition 2280c is highlighted in green, the right displayed set 2260c can be displayed in green.

In some examples, displaying the displayed sets in a similar manner to their respective partitions may inform the user which regions of the virtual keyboard 2120 may receive a gesture to input the desired displayed set.

While the present disclosure is described, at least in part, in terms of methods, a person of ordinary skill in the art will understand that the present disclosure is also directed to the various components for performing at least some of the aspects and features of the described methods, be it by way of hardware components, software or any combination of the two, or in any other manner. Moreover, the present disclosure is also directed to a pre-recorded storage device or other similar computer readable medium including program instructions stored thereon for performing the methods described herein.

The present disclosure may be embodied in other specific forms without departing from the subject matter of the claims. The described example embodiments are to be considered in all respects as being only illustrative and not restrictive. The present disclosure intends to cover and embrace all suitable changes in technology. The scope of the present disclosure is, therefore, described by the appended claims rather than by the foregoing description. All changes that come within the meaning and range of equivalency of the claims are intended to be embraced within their scope.

claim.claim-text: The method of claim 1, wherein a position of the partition corresponds to the position of the selected set in the defined arrangement.

The method of claim 1 or claim 2, further comprising displaying the input character; wherein displaying the at least two of the generated sets comprises displaying the at least two of the generated sets proximate to the input character.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein displaying the at least two of the generated sets in the defined arrangement comprises displaying the at least two of the generated sets horizontally; and wherein the virtual keyboard is partitioned into at least two columns.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein displaying the at least two of the generated sets in the defined arrangement comprises displaying the at least two of the generated sets vertically; and wherein the virtual keyboard is partitioned into at least two rows.
The method of any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the virtual keyboard is partitioned into at least two partitions, the method further comprising highlighting the at least two partitions.

The method of claim 6, wherein the at least two partitions are highlighted in different colours, and wherein displaying the at least two of the generated sets comprises displaying each of the displayed sets in the colour of the corresponding partition.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 7, wherein displaying the at least two of the generated sets comprises highlighting the displayed set having a highest ranking, and wherein selecting one of the displayed sets comprises selecting the displayed set having the highest ranking when a predefined gesture is received.
The method of claim 8, wherein highlighting the displayed set having the highest ranking comprises displaying the displayed set having the highest ranking in-line with the input character.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 9, wherein the position of each of the displayed sets in the defined arrangement is associated with a different gesture, and wherein selecting the one of the displayed sets comprises selecting the displayed set in the position corresponding to the received gesture.
